title: Masala Dosa
steps: Soak rice and urad dal overnight.
Grind them to make smooth batter.
Ferment for 8 hours.
Make dosas on hot tawa.
Serve with chutney.

title: Paneer Butter Masala
steps: Heat butter and sauté onions.
Add tomato puree and cook.
Add spices and paneer.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish and serve hot.

title: Aloo Paratha
steps: Boil and mash potatoes.
Mix with spices to make filling.
Stuff into dough and roll.
Cook on tawa with ghee.
Serve with curd and pickle.

title: Pancakes
steps: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add milk, egg, and melted butter. Whisk well.
Pour batter on a hot pan and cook until bubbles form.
Flip and cook the other side until golden brown.
Serve with maple syrup or fruits.

title: Chole Bhature
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight.
Pressure cook chickpeas with tea bags and spices.
Prepare spicy gravy with tomatoes and onions.
Knead dough for bhature and let it rest.
Roll out bhature and deep fry.
Serve hot with chole, onion rings, and lemon.

title: Vegetable Biryani
steps: Wash and soak basmati rice.
Sauté whole spices and onions in oil.
Add chopped vegetables and biryani masala.
Layer rice and veggie mix, cover and cook.
Garnish with mint, fried onions, and serve hot.

title: Chocolate Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Mix flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda.
Blend sugar, oil, and eggs in another bowl.
Combine wet and dry ingredients.
Pour into greased pan and bake for 30 minutes.
Cool and frost with chocolate ganache.

title: Idli Sambar
steps: Soak rice and urad dal overnight.
Grind into batter and ferment.
Pour into idli molds and steam for 10 minutes.
Boil toor dal and mix with veggies for sambar.
Add sambar masala and temper with mustard seeds.
Serve idli with hot sambar and coconut chutney.

title: Pani Puri
steps: Prepare spicy mint-coriander water (pani).
Make tamarind chutney with jaggery.
Boil and mash potatoes, mix with spices.
Make small puris and deep fry until crispy.
Fill puris with potato mixture and chickpeas.
Dip in pani and enjoy immediately!

title: Gulab Jamun
steps: Mix khoya, maida, and baking soda to make dough.
Make small balls without cracks.
Deep fry on low heat until golden brown.
Prepare sugar syrup with cardamom and saffron.
Soak fried balls in warm syrup for 2 hours.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with nuts.

title: Samosa
steps: Prepare dough with maida, oil, and water.
Make spiced potato filling with peas.
Roll dough into thin circles and cut in half.
Form cone shapes and fill with potato mixture.
Seal edges and deep fry until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with mint chutney and tamarind sauce.

title: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices for 2 hours.
Grill or pan-fry marinated chicken pieces.
Prepare tomato-based gravy with butter and cream.
Add grilled chicken to the gravy.
Simmer for 10 minutes, add kasuri methi.
Garnish with cream and serve with naan or rice.
